result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
4:49 PM Defendant Keno Kendez Lockridge Jr in court.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia on behalf of Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Keno Kendez Lockridge Jr. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. 
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date in 60 days or so.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Hearing on August 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:57 AM Defendant Keno Kendez Lockridge in court with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.  Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for status.
Defense has received discovery.
State is sending an offer. 
  Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on July 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:22 AM Defendant Keno Kendez Lockridge in court with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State Trooper Lorenzen sworn and testified by Atty. Thompson.  Cross examination by Atty. Jensen.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Thompson moves for bind over.  Atty. Jensen objects to bind over and moves to amend the complaint as there was no evidence of prior misdemeanors for the repeator enhancer and dismiss count #2.  Atty. Thompson objects as count #2 is a bail jumping and the enhancer is for misdemeanors and not a felony so probable cause does not be proven at this hearing.    Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 3, 2022 at 09:15 am.

02:03 PM Defendant Keno Kendez Lockridge in court with Attorney Andrew Herbers for Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

03:29 PM Defendant Keno Kendez Lockridge in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant states he just came into custody this morning.  Public Defender representative indicates they will put the defendant on their list to be evaluated tomorrow.  The Court directs the jail to allow the defendant to make a phone call so he may contact someone in regards to posting his cash bail.  Court sets a status of counsel date tomorrow so the defendant may be evaluated.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
